{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36939].
  {panel}

In the step of Update Fields (step 3 of 4), when we need to update Assignee, the rest api returns error and we could not even type properly. Steps to reproduce:
# create two projects: ABC and DEF
# create more issues in ABC than DEF, say ABC-1, ABC-2, and DEF-1
# create two permission schemes that differ only in issue Assignable, in ABC, allow user1 but in DEF, disallow user1 as assignable
# set assignee to user1 in ABC-2
# try to move ABC-2
# in step 3 of 4, you are prompted to update the assignee field, but the rest api for autocomplete always return 404:
#* http://localhost:8090/jira/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/search?username=d&projectKeys=DEF&issueKey=DEF-2&maxResults=1000&_=1381811520617

It looks like the issueKey was constructed with the new project key concatenated with the old numeric id, i.e., DEF-2.

Another problem with this update fields step is that even if you enter user1 manually, and click save, it will accept the value, even though user1 is not a valid assignee in the new project DEF.

I've also observed the same issue when I was prompted to update a custom field and the context provided for custom field validation is from the old project id. Though that's not very reproducible.
fields.summary: Update fields during Move issue does not provide correct context for validation

Summary:

When creating a dependency link between two Jira issues using Issue Links, two choices are:

 - Depends on
 - is dependent on

Actual Behavior:  These mean exactly the same thing; this is just a tense change (if A depends on B, then A is dependent on B.)

Expected Behavior:  These two choices should be the inverse of each other.


Three alternative suggestions:

1. Formal dependency language (see http://depfind.sourceforge.net/Manual.html#Dependencies for a fuller explanation):
 - is dependent on
 - is dependable on
 
2. Clearer English:
 - depends on
 - is needed by

3. Or, if you're willing to get rid of the word "depend" altogether:
 - requires
 - is required by

Also, the "D" in "Depends on" shouldn't be capitalized.
fields.summary: Incorrect dependency language when creating Issue Links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36936].
  {panel}

Currently, all custom fields are told to ensure their javascript is loaded in the {{atl.general}} context. The disadvantages of this approach are:

* Custom fields will only ever work in pages in the {{atl.general}} context -- in other words, not admin and other areas.
** For this reason, the quick-create dialog, for instance, cannot work in any section outside of {{atl.general}} (see JRA-36519).
* The code to run custom fields will always be loaded, even when it doesn't need to (as in, the fields it should affect aren't used or present on the page)
* The dump-it-into-a-context approach makes the implementation of plugins like the issue collector difficult -- it has to load all JS assets for the {{atl.general}} context, rather than just the assets required to make the issue creation form work.

We should build a better way to package up and deliver the assets required to make a custom field work.
fields.summary: Change how custom fields define and load javascript

fields.description:
Root cause of this problem is a rendering bug in IE11(CAS-568). The fix(https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/changelog/jira-git?cs=8f46f88a0b33e18d8cd8e4378f67a801cb595e8d) removed height 100% from draghandle in order to fix rendering artifact under IE11.

This problem should be fixed in following steps:
1. fix AJS.describeBrowser (it should detect IE11 properly)
2. remove the override in JIRA
3. bring back height 100% in AUI RESTful table css
4. add IE11 specific rule which removes 100% from drag handle or provides similar effect without rendering bug, this change should not affect any other browers

hint: the rendering bug is caused by form controls nested in each row of RESTful table, I did not find any workaround yet.
fields.summary: Drag handle in RESTful table is not 100% height

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36916].
  {panel}

When configuring LDAP user directory, the length of characters that can be entered for either User or Group Object filter is restricted by the Attribute_Value column of the CWD_Directory_Attribute table to 255 characters. However, the length of this input is not validated on the browser side. So when an object filter longer than 255 characters is entered into the field it fails against the database server causing an ugly SQL exception to be thrown at the user.

It's better to add validation for this entry on the client side for a few reasons:
* Although, standard databases would reject the input, Hsql for instance, did not enforce this column constraint and accepted the entry. This may cause failure in the future, if a user tries to migrate the same instance from Hsql to a production-worthy environment.
* The related bug report, regarding increasing the ammount of characters allowed for filters has been marked as wont fix (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24799), so having a user friendly message that warns the user about this limitation/restriction will be nice.
fields.summary: Add input validation for length of entries into the Object filter fields in LDAP Configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36915].
  {panel}

This is a feedback from one of our customers regarding the feature that allows you to edit JIRA statuses directly by selecting it from a project workflow.

It appears that while administering project workflows, some project administrators who incidentally also have JIRA Administrators global permission, do not realise the global effect of their actions when they are editing statuses directly from a project workflow.

Ofcourse Project Administrators who do not have the JIRA Administrator global permission are not able to edit statuses at all. But for those with the permission, there may indeed be a likelihood that inexperienced JIRA project administrators, while editing a workflow that is limited to their project, may assume that editing the statuses(e.g status description) is limited to their project as well, not knowing that these changes are actually global, and would affect all workflows using the status.

Perhaps it's best not to allow statuses to be editable from within the workflow, or perhaps it's possible to make it a bit more obvious (perhaps by a warning) that such changes are global.
fields.summary: Allowing the edit of global JIRA statuses, directly from project workflow, may be counter-intuitive

fields.description:
We are developing a JIRA plugin that as part of its functionality is listening for several events including IssueTypeCreatedEvent.
What we've noticed is that when a Sub-Task is added through the Issue Type management page(/secure/admin/ViewIssueTypes.jspa), an event of type IssueTypeCreatedEvent gets 
published, whereas when you do the same through the Sub-Tasks admin page (secure/admin/subtasks/ManageSubTasks.jspa), it does not. On further investigation (by looking at the JIRA's source code)
it appears that the sequence of calls following the form submission is different. 
When adding a Sub-Task through the IssueType administration page the sequence of calls results into the method createIssueTypeAndAddToDefaultScheme getting called on the instance of DefaultIssueTypeManager and that method publishes the IssueTypeCreatedEvent event. We were not able to find any place where the event would get published when following the chain of calls of the form submission from the Sub-Task administration page.
fields.summary: IssueTypeCreatedEvent does not get published when a Sub-Task type is added through the Sub-Tasks administration page.

Hello team,
                   It would be very nice if the Bulk change feature could handle an "Confirm & keep working with this set of issues" button next to the actual Confirm button that executes the changes. 

Sometimes we have to make several bulk changes to n isues within a filter (advance two workflow steps, for instance) and after we transition the whole bunch to the first step, we have to make another bulk change and select the same relevant issues again in order to transition them to the next step.

The possibility to select issues within a filter, and then make several bulk changes to that set would be very handy and would save a lot of time.

Thank you so much for making Jira even better on each new release,

Best Regards

We recently upgraded our PROD environment to Jira 6.1.7 and the JiraCLI from BobSwift is now not working. The Vendor has also not been able to reproduce the issue on his 6.1.7 test instance.  Please see his note below :

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36904].
  {panel}

If you work with JIRA in multiple tabs the "Create" function does not set the active project from that specific tab, but the last visited project cross-tab.

We use JIRA with JIRA Agile, but problem exists in JIRA basic as well.

- Open JIRA in 2 tabs
- Go to *Tab 1* and open an Agile board
- Go to *Tab 2* and open another Agile board (refering another project)
- Go back to tab 1 and click "Create issue" in the menu (or Create epic)
- The project selected is the one you requested in tab2, not the one you currently have on your screen.

This selection is quickly overlooked and we experience often that issues are created in the incorrect projects. In our case a wish from Customer A which is created in the project from Customer B.
fields.summary: Create issue/epic does not set active project from current page

fields.description:
This is a classic Bugzilla migration situation where we have an externalIssueID column associated with a number of our bugs.  One of our users, here, attempted to do the following:

# Start a new, empty search.
# Switch to the List View in the navigator.
# Open the Columns list and add External issue ID to the list.

At this point, the column absolutely appears in the navigator as you would expect.  Then he:

# Clicked on the External issue ID column to sort (understanding this is expected to sort lexicographically).

Upon clicking on the column header, the column vanishes from the List VIew.  Any attempts to re-add the column to the List VIew fail... the column refused to reappear until a new search is executed, though attempting to sort on it once again triggers the issue.

Note, this test also fails with a saved search.  While the column is present in the saved search, sorting on the column upon opening the search causes the column to also disappear.

Update:  Further testing seems to explain the behaviour: if any issues in the resultset *don't have the field*, then the column gets eliminated from the list view.  That is, qualifying the search by "externalIssueId is not empty" results in correct behaviour.

While we *can* simply sort for issues containing the external IDs we're interested in, this is definitely a significant nuisance, as during this transition phase we're going to need to move back and forth between JIRA and Bugzilla issue IDs, as the latter are recorded in various release notes and so forth,
fields.summary: Custom fields disappear from the navigator List View upon sorting on them

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36881].
  {panel}

h4. Context
When using JQL with auto-complete switched on, searching for fields will always list global values. For instance, when using the IN operator in JQL, auto-complete will "give away" values for the majority of fields. Given that for each individual project there are schemes restricting or limiting the available fields, only context-specific values should be accessible for the user.
The current behaviour seems to be potentially problematic with regard to usability or security concerns.

h4. Objective
As a user, I want the auto-complete function to only present field values relevant for my context.

With "my context" meaning:
# Projects, I have permission to browse; or 
# Values for fields that are configured/enabled via a scheme configuration for that project.

_In other words: the behaviour and underlying logic of JIRA's JQL search capabilities should respect project configuration and permissions to not reveal global field values._

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create a user that has access only to one particular project.
# Configure the project in the following way:
## A basic workflow (eg. only with three statuses TODO, DOING, DONE).
## No Custom Fields used on any screen or any scheme;
# In JIRA, browse to "Search for issues" in Advanced mode and try the following:
## status IN (
 -> Auto-complete will display a preview of all existing statuses (in addition to our three).
## project IN ("My Project") AND
 -> A preview of globally existing custom fields will be displayed.

Other fields which are affected by the described behaviour as well are:
* Issue Type 
* Status
* Assignee
* Resolution
* Component
* FixVersion
* Custom Fields

h4. Footnote
* The search for projects _does_ respect the configuration. As a user, auto-complete only displays a list of projects I am authorised to browse:
{code}
project IN ( 
{code}
fields.summary: Improve filter behaviour: auto-complete should not give away field values

h3. Summary

If a project is deleted from JIRA, it will break the FeCru integration due to errors being thrown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a JIRA project.
# Link it to FeCru.
# Delete the JIRA project.

h3. Expected Results

No errors occur.

h3. Actual Results

The below exceptions are thrown in the logs:

{noformat}

Additionally the issue panels do not render with the below errors:

{quote}
"Error rendering 'com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin:fisheye-issuepanel'. Please contact your JIRA administrators."
"Error rendering 'com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin:crucible-issuepanel'. Please contact your JIRA administrators."
{quote}

h3. Workaround

Either add a temporary dummy project to replace the deleted one. This can also be resolved by rolling back the plugin to 6.1.0 by downloading it from the the [Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin/versions] and installing it.
fields.summary: Deleting a JIRA project breaks the FishEye/Crucible integration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36874].
  {panel}

User would like to disable the the 'jira-help-tips' system module. However doing so causes internet explorer to throw errors in Internet explorer 8-10.

Steps to reproduce:

- disable the 'jira-help-tips' module from system add ons
- Using IE8 or IE 10, go to Tools > Internet Options > Advanced > Browsing Tab
Check the "Display Notifications For Every Script Error" option
- Access any filter in JIRA

Images of the Javascript errors are attached
fields.summary: Prevent any javascript errors from being thrown when disable jira-help-tips system module

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36872].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Projects which has long titles will not display the whole title.
h3. Suggested Solution
Make the dropdown wider
h3. Workaround
Hovering the mouse over the top of the project title
(!) This workaround is not applicable for JIRA version 6.4, 7.0 and 7.1
fields.summary: Screen Design - Project dropdown too narrow

fields.description:
Steps to repro:

* Disable user in User mgmt interface by unchecking the Active tick box.
* Go to Send Email in admin interface
* Send email to a group which the above member is a part of
* Check the email set on the inactive user and you will see that an email has been sent

Expected:

* Inactive user should not receive email notifications.
fields.summary: Send Email admin functionality contacts inactive users
this is a summary of a task

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36869].
  {panel}

The current global admin role / permission doesn't work for us. We need to split admin into the following functions with associated groups / roles:

* User & Group Management : jira-users-admin group/role
* Projects : jira-projects-admin group/role
* Issues : jira-issues-admin group/role
* System including Addons : jira-system-admin group/role
fields.summary: Split up admin role into new specific admin roles each with their own assigned admins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36868].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian team

We have released Tempo Timesheet 7.8.1.3 including 2 fixes that are critical for many of our customers and 1 fix that is critical for the OnDemand users who have not enabled Tempo Timesheets.

Fixes included in this version are as follows:

Tempo button on Agile Board visible although plugin is disabled
_This fix was delivered in Timesheets 7.8.1.2_
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36835
https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/TT-371

Project, Account and Advanced Timesheets empty if JIRA Time Tracking field has been hidden in Field Configuration
https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/TT-365

Error on the team permissions page when a group with a team permission has been deleted
https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/TT-376

Please include this version in the upgrade for JIRA 6.2-OD9 or 6.2-OD10 release on OnDemand

*All details for Atlassian staff are on this page:*

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When making a Bulk Edit of Epic Link, the Confirmation Screen shows the old epic value, however the value is changed.
It might confuse some users.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Fresh install JIRA 6.x and JIRA Agile 6.3.7
# Create a Scrum project and two Epic Issues.
# Create Issues for this project and link to one of the Epics.
# Perform a search on these Issues and then perform a Bulk edit.
# During the Bulk Edit, change the Epic Link from one Epic to another.
# In the confirmation screen, it will show the old Epic value, instead the new one, however if you proceed it will change the epic.

I was able to reproduce with JIRA 6.1.7, 6.1.5, 6.0.5, all with the latest Agile version.

h3. Expected Behaviour
Show the new Epic Link value in the confirmation screen.

h3. Actual Results
The old Epic Link value will be shown in the confirmation screen.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround
fields.summary: When making a Bulk Edit of Epic Link, the Confirmation Screen shows the old epic value.

fields.description:
The current implementation of the {{MainHeaderLinksContextProvider}} class allows to have two items with exactly the same ID.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install the eazyBI plugin
# Install the Pathfinder plugin

The top-level nav should contain two new positions - each of them will have the same {{id="home"}}

h3. Impact

If they are just buttons in the topnav - nothing except duplicated ids in HTML. But if they were drop-downs then they would be clashing with each other showing inappropriate content for those drop-downs.

h3. Suggested Solution

The technical solution also disallow to create drop-down items with non-unique ids. 

There are few possible solutions. The best one would be namespacing those IDs with plugin's key. 

There are possible dependencies on those id's (which eventually are printed out to HTML) that would need fixing. For example, Plugin vendors (and JIRA Core) may use those IDs to bind javascript actions and styling.

Consequently, fixing this only seems to be viable in a breaking release (7.0 for instance)
fields.summary: Top level navigation links may contain duplicated item id's

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attempting to reindex JIRA fails with the below exception. This does not fail for *all* issues, only a couple. It also causes JIRA Agile's upgrade tasks to fail, as tracked in GHS-10348.

h3. Environment

* Java 7

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Restore an instance with problematic data.
# Install JIRA Agile and upgrade.

h3. Expected Results

The reindex completes without error.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown:

{noformat}
2014-02-04 11:31:28,768 JiraTaskExectionThread-2 ERROR admin 685x278x1 o72kxu 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [jira.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager] Reindex All FAILED.  Indexer: DefaultIndexManager: paths: [/Users/dcurrie/deployments/jira617/jira-home/caches/indexes/comments, /Users/dcurrie/deployments/jira617/jira-home/caches/indexes/issues, /Users/dcurrie/deployments/jira617/jira-home/caches/indexes/changes]
com.atlassian.jira.index.IndexingFailureException: Indexing completed with 3 errors
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder$CompositeResult.await(AccumulatingResultBuilder.java:147)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.doIndexIssuesInBatchMode(DefaultIndexManager.java:877)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.doStopTheWorldReindex(DefaultIndexManager.java:844)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexAll(DefaultIndexManager.java:307)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexAll(DefaultIndexManager.java:272)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexAll(DefaultIndexManager.java:267)  <+3> (NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57) (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
	at com.atlassian.util.profiling.object.ObjectProfiler.profiledInvoke(ObjectProfiler.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:28)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy140.reIndexAll(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.reIndexAll(CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.java:56)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.doReindex(ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.call(AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.call(ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.java:16)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.call(AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.java:23)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:374)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:250)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
{noformat}

Tracking back into the logs reveals that exceptions were thrown during the indexing (the timestamp on this log is different however it's the same problem):

{noformat}
2014-03-08 21:07:32,716 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN captain.planet 1267x112x1 h86sjy 74.57.203.161,127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Comparison method violates its general contract!
{noformat}

h3. Notes

It is important to note that indexing _mostly_ finishes. It seems to fail for one or more issues that throws that exception.

h3.Solution
Upgrade JIRA to 6.2.3+ using the instructions at [Upgrading JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA].

h3. Workaround
# Some customers have reported that reindexing has worked after upgrading to Java 1.7_u51. To check if this works for you, download the new Java and declare your JAVA_HOME variable in {{bin/setenv.bat}} (Windows) or {{bin/setenv.sh}} before you restart JIRA. Downtime is required to restart JIRA and re-index.
# Downgrade Java to 1.6, perform the index, then switch JIRA back to 1.7. We recommend to do this only do this if there is no other option. Switching to Java 6 will allow the issues to be indexed. Please note that Java 6 is not supported in later versions of JIRA as per [Supported Platforms|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms]. Downtime is required for two JIRA restarts and an indexing.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36840].
  {panel}

These kinds of Text Field have two display modes: Expand mode (default full view) and Collapse mode (minimized to 1 single line).

In Expand mode, hyperlinks are displayed correctly as links:
!expand.png|thumbnail!

In Collapse mode, only plain text is displayed (no links), and all lines are grouped into 1 single line (with *...* at the end if the line too long):
!collapse.png|thumbnail!

Customers would still like to see the hyper links in Collapse mode and, in most cases, would only want to see the first line.

fields.summary: Error message received when attempting workflow transition
Possibility to control the project templates (Project Type)

fields.description:
Resolving JRA-25705 meant that avatars are now embedded in notification emails, and able to be seen even if checking one's email offline. This is not the case yet for smileys , issue type icons or the padlock, though.

Whoever picks this issue up should check for other images that may need inlining, too.

See the linked issue for reproduction steps.
fields.summary: Smileys issue type icons and the padlock are still not shown in email notifications
